Recent updates in New York include a salmonella outbreak linked to raw oysters, BP labeling Staten Island battery sites as dangerous after multiple fires, and a significant drop in school attendance due to flu season, while holiday travel is expected to be complicated by mixed weather conditions.

### Risks & Alerts

- After a third fire at a Staten Island battery energy storage site, BP labels the locations as ‘dangerous’. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- New York is experiencing a salmonella outbreak linked to raw oysters; avoid consuming them. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiogFBVV95cUxQR2lKR1Jfd2hrQUFiclpQV3FFLXFUOHJkOUxKOTU0QW1tVl90YlRvWVk2aUtDR1pXbmtBNVBqUkZ6YXlwMVdFWWRGbERpSVM5R3duX0RzbE05LXBBREZJUml3YWkzSTdHYkpYMVJqclV0WjdpZ1M0Ry02TnZ4dHA3bjJoOXY2bDlFQ1ZsWmw5MGFZN0xJOWtDM2hEME9udVU1aWc?oc=5)
- Three people were injured when a car crashed into a building and struck pedestrians in Queens. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- A mix of snow and rain is expected to disrupt holiday travel in the New York and New Jersey area. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC will enforce DWI laws aggressively during the winter holidays as part of the Vision Zero initiative. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- A year-end holiday travel advisory has been issued by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
